### Energy Star Appliance Data Study

#### Background and Scope
The Department of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) has a requirement to track market trends in energy efficiency and energy use under the Energy Efficiency Act. To this end, NRCan collects and analyzes data on energy use and energy efficiency of major appliances dating back to 1990. 

#### Contractor Expectations

The department is seeking a contractor to collect annual appliance shipment data (with model numbers allowing linkage to the EnerGuide Appliance Database) to obtain unit energy consumption (UEC) for the following appliances: refrigerators (including wine chillers), freezers, dishwashers, electric ranges, clothes washers, electric clothes dryers, and dehumidifiers for the year 2023.

#### Description of Deliverables

The delivery involving the collection of 2023 data is expected to entail:

* Providing annual shipment data for the specified appliances with detailed information, including model numbers to ensure linkage to the EnerGuide appliance database
* Provide unit energy consumption (UEC) for each appliance type for the year 2023

#### Requirements and Evaluation Criteria

* *(Please review the attached document [links in French](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6374/nrcan-acan-5000073350-en.pdf) and [French](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6374/rncan-pac-5000073350-fr.pdf) for detailed response)*)*

#### Deliverables Timeline

Estimated contract duration is five years starting from July 2023, with delivery milestones anticipated every quarter.

#### Contact Information
